direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve the head of the queue without removing it.
Both methods retrieve elements from the queue, but poll() also removes the element.
Both methods involve synchronized access to the queue and handle similar control flows.
Both methods retrieve and remove elements from the queue, but element() throws an exception if the queue is empty.
Both methods handle synchronization and potential exceptions related to object comparison.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializes the queue that will be decorated by the element() method.
Adds elements to the queue, which is necessary for testing the element() method.
Both methods retrieve the head of the queue, making peek() useful for assertions after calling element().
